block.p: Recent Sale $12 million 1177 Flushing Avenue Brooklyn The owner of Jovani, a women's fashion company, plans to turn this single-story 83,000-square-foot warehouse in East Williamsburg into a showroom and to add another floor with a rooftop parking area. Buyer: Saul Maslavi Seller: Noel Levin Brokers: Neil Dolgin and Linda Wong, Kalmon Dolgin Affiliates

Recent Lease $36/sq. ft. approximate annual rent $180,000 15-17 West 18th Street (between Fifth and Avenue of the Americas) Manhattan A new media company has signed a 10-year lease for the entire 5,000-square-foot top floor of this 10-story 1903 building in the Flatiron district. Tenant: Expo Communications Tenant broker: Ted Rotante, GVA Williams Landlord: First Flatiron Landlord brokers: Rob and Joan Fields, Synergy Realty

For Sale $8.9 million 9 Christopher Street (between Greenwich Avenue and Waverly Place) Manhattan This five-story 1886 Queen Anne style walk-up in the Greenwich Village Historic District has 13 apartments and two retail spaces. Owner: DP23 Brokers: James Nelson, Brendan Gotch and Billy Simons, Massey Knakal Realty Services

Recent Sale $12 million 1177 Flushing Avenue Brooklyn The owner of Jovani, a women's fashion company, plans to turn this single-story 83,000-square-foot warehouse in East Williamsburg into a showroom and to add another floor with a rooftop parking area. Buyer: Saul Maslavi Seller: Noel Levin Brokers: Neil Dolgin and Linda Wong, Kalmon Dolgin Affiliates

Recent Lease $36/sq. ft. approximate annual rent $180,000 15-17 West 18th Street (between Fifth and Avenue of the Americas) Manhattan A new media company has signed a 10-year lease for the entire 5,000-square-foot top floor of this 10-story 1903 building in the Flatiron district. Tenant: Expo Communications Tenant broker: Ted Rotante, GVA Williams Landlord: First Flatiron Landlord brokers: Rob and Joan Fields, Synergy Realty

For Sale $8.9 million 9 Christopher Street (between Greenwich Avenue and Waverly Place) Manhattan This five-story 1886 Queen Anne style walk-up in the Greenwich Village Historic District has 13 apartments and two retail spaces. Owner: DP23 Brokers: James Nelson, Brendan Gotch and Billy Simons, Massey Knakal Realty Services

Correction: June 8, 2007, Friday An entry in the Transactions column in the Square Feet pages of Business Day on Wednesday about a recent lease at 15-17 West 18th Street in Manhattan misstated the term of the lease. It is for five years, not 10 years.

An entry in the Transactions column in the Square Feet pages of Business Day on Wednesday about a recent lease at 15-17 West 18th Street in Manhattan misstated the term of the lease. It is for five years, not 10 years.
